subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 15 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Transfer probe queries 17 deals
Seventeen transfers and five Premier League clubs are named in Lord Stevens' probe into alleged transfer irregularities.



 
Ashley boosts stake in Newcastle
Mike Ashley is on course to withdraw Newcastle United from the stock exchange after lifting his stake.



 
Spurs new favourites to land Bent
Spurs are in pole position to land Darren Bent after he turns down a move to West Ham.








GOLF




Live - US Open
England's Paul Casey makes the big move despite difficult scoring conditions in the second round of the US Open.



 
Classy Casey makes Oakmont move
England's Paul Casey posts a remarkable four-under 66 to set a challenging halfway target at the US Open.



 
US Open clubhouse scores
Latest scores from Oakmont.








MOTORSPORT




Alonso sets pace in Indianapolis
McLaren's Fernando Alonso is fastest in first practice for Sunday's US Grand Prix with team-mate Lewis Hamilton third.



 
Bayliss sets pace in San Marino
World Superbikes champion Troy Bayliss claims provisional pole for the San Marino Grand Prix.



 
Loeb trailing Higgins in Donegal
British champion Mark Higgins leads world champion Sebastian Loeb after day one of the Donegal International Rally.








FORMULA ONE




Alonso sets pace in Indianapolis
McLaren's Fernando Alonso is fastest in first practice for Sunday's US Grand Prix with team-mate Lewis Hamilton third.



 
Hamilton rejects Alonso complaint
Lewis Hamilton describes Fernando Alonso's claim that McLaren are favouring him as "strange".



 
Kubica ruled out of Indianapolis
BMW Sauber driver Robert Kubica is out of the US Grand Prix after doctors rule he is not fit to race after his crash in Canada.








ATHLETICS




Yelling withdraws from GB squad
Liz Yelling pulls out of the GB marathon squad for this summer's World Athletics Championships in Osaka.



 
Powell eyes Golden League repeat
Asafa Powell steps his quest for a first global 100m crown at Friday's Golden League opener in Norway.



 
Tomlinson leap boosts Cup hopes
Long jumper Chris Tomlinson produces his best effort for nearly three years in Prague ahead of the European Cup.








CYCLING




Basso handed two-year doping ban
Ivan Basso receives the maximum two-year doping ban from the Italian cycling federation.



 
Hammond eyes Tour de France spot
Briton Roger Hammond heads to the Tour de Suisse on Saturday hoping to secure a spot at next month's Tour de France.



 
Moreau wins to boost Libere hopes
Christophe Moreau claims a solo win in stage four of the Dauphine Libere to climb to second overall.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Michael Vaughan hits the town as Messi keeps his hand in



 
Quotes of the Week
Ramon Calderon on David Beckham, plus Lewis Hamilton and Graham Taylor



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport
